main event: Multiple towns in the Houston metropolitan area reported a sighting of a stationary round object with a brilliant and dull glow over a three-hour period on August 26, 1965.
interesting points: The object appeared round and about the size of a dime, emitting colors of red, green, and white., The object remained stationary but moved up and down, showing a red glow that alternated with green and white., Reports came from nearby towns within three hours, indicating it was widely seen., The object was observed without sound, trail, or exhaust, raising further questions about its nature., Local law enforcement investigated, but preliminary findings suggested the sightings could be due to surface lights reflecting off an inversion layer.
sighted object: round object with alternating colors of red, green, and white
witness description: Sheriff Balis from the Fort Bend Sheriff's Office
